column4: Hi, when trying to build wine from source using APT, 'apt-get --build source wine' stops with error "checking for C compiler default output file name... configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
Build command 'cd wine-0.9.11~winehq1 && dpkg-buildpackage -b -uc' failed."
install build-essential
i'd guess something like 'apt-get build-dep wine' would also be helpful
ok, thanks
yes, i have already done that
I guess build-essential isn't in the build dependencies -- odd.
build-essential is alrady installed to the newest version
hmm. And 'gcc -v' outputs something informative ?
in that case I don't know what the error is.  Are you running ubuntu 5.10 (breezy) ?
yes AMD64

hmm. there seems to be no binary packages for wine on amd64 -- perhaps it can't be built there ? see http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=wine&searchon=names&subword=1&version=breezy&release=all
wine has only had time to provide i386 versions
yes, all the packages listed there are i386, apart from the libaries
well, my point is, if canonical/ubuntu can't build it, maybe it can't be done
maybe it's possible to do a 32-bit chroot thing, but that is beyond my knowledge
yes, i thake your point, do you think that i meight just be better off instaling the i386 build provided
if you know how to do that, sure. I don't ;) sorry.
ok, thanks for the help
try running 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg'
runlevels work differently in ubuntu to redhat/suse
once the machine starts, trying Ctrl-Alt-F1 to get a console, or boot in recovery mode
